conbody.p: In Managed and Managed (No VLAN) modes, Eucalyptus flushes the CC's iptables rules for both filter and nat, then it sets the default policy for the FORWARD chain in filter to DROP. At run time, the CC adds and removes rules from FORWARD as users add and remove ingress rules from their active security groups. In addition, the nat table is configured to allow VMs access to the external network using IP masquerading, and dynamically adds/removes rules in the nat table as users assign and unassign public IPs to VMs at instance boot or run-time.
